member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.CancellationTokenTaskSource`1
member.summary: Holds the task for a cancellation token, as well as the token registration. The registration is disposed when this instance is disposed.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.CancellationTokenTaskSource`1._registration
member.summary: The cancellation token registration, if any. This is null if the registration was not necessary.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.CancellationTokenTaskSource`1.#ctor(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a task for the specified cancellation token, registering with the token if necessary.
member.param: The cancellation token to observe.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.CancellationTokenTaskSource`1.Task
member.summary: Gets the task for the source cancellation token.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.CancellationTokenTaskSource`1.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the cancellation token registration, if any. Note that this may cause to never complete.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.Interop.ApmAsyncFactory
member.summary: Creation methods for tasks wrapping the Asynchronous Programming Model (APM), and APM wrapper methods around tasks.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.Interop.ApmAsyncFactory.ToBegin(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Wraps a into the Begin method of an APM pattern.
member.param: The task to wrap.
The callback method passed into the Begin method of the APM pattern.
The state passed into the Begin method of the APM pattern.
member.returns: The asynchronous operation, to be returned by the Begin method of the APM pattern.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.Interop.ApmAsyncFactory.ToEnd(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Wraps a into the End method of an APM pattern.
member.param: The asynchronous operation returned by the matching Begin method of this APM pattern.
member.returns: The result of the asynchronous operation, to be returned by the End method of the APM pattern.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.Interop.ApmAsyncFactory.ToBegin``1(System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0},System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Wraps a into the Begin method of an APM pattern.
member.param: The task to wrap. May not be null.
The callback method passed into the Begin method of the APM pattern.
The state passed into the Begin method of the APM pattern.
member.returns: The asynchronous operation, to be returned by the Begin method of the APM pattern.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.Interop.ApmAsyncFactory.ToEnd``1(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Wraps a into the End method of an APM pattern.
member.param: The asynchronous operation returned by the matching Begin method of this APM pattern.
member.returns: The result of the asynchronous operation, to be returned by the End method of the APM pattern.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.Interop.EventArguments`2
member.summary: Arguments passed to a .NET event that follows the standard sender, arguments event pattern.
member.typeparam: The type of the sender of the event. This is commonly .
The type of the event arguments. This is commonly or a derived type.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.Interop.EventArguments`2.Sender
member.summary: The sender of the event.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.Interop.EventArguments`2.EventArgs
member.summary: The event arguments.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.Interop.EventAsyncFactory
member.summary: Creation methods for tasks wrapping events.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.Interop.EventAsyncFactory.FromAnyEvent``2(System.Func{System.Action{``1},``0},System.Action{``0},System.Action{``0},System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a that completes when a specified event next fires. This overload is for events that are of any type.
member.typeparam: The type of the event delegate.
A type containing all event arguments.
member.param: A conversion delegate that takes an and converts it to a . This is generally of the form x => (...) => x(new TEventArguments(...)).
A method that takes a and subscribes it to the event.
A method that takes an and unsubscribes it from the event. This method is invoked in a captured context if is true.
A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the task (and unsubscribe from the event handler).
Whether to invoke on a captured context.

remarks.para: Calling this method in a loop is often an anti-pattern, because the event is only subscribed to when this method is invoked, and is unsubscribed from when the task completes. From the time the task is completed until this method is called again, the event may fire and be "lost". If you find yourself needing a loop around this method, consider using Rx or TPL Dataflow instead.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.SynchronizationContextSwitcher.NoContext(System.Action)

member.summary: Executes a synchronous or asynchronous delegate without the current . The current context is restored when this function synchronously returns.
